issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
UPDATED 2015-08-11: The Summary word breaking challenge appears to occur across all wizards (for example, Launch Instance, Create Stack, Create Scaling Group, Create Load Balancer). So, as Jenny requested, I changed the issue title and bumped up the priority.

 --------------------------------------------------------------------------------

In the Create Stack Summary on the right side of the page, the word breaking appears to be off. For example, the word "allowing" was broken across two different lines as "allo" and "wing" (see image).

Can we improve the way we break words across lines in the Summary?

comments.body: Huh. I thought I assigned this one to you Kamal. Are you the right person for it?

[~lnajjar]: We normally scrub (i.e. assign) tickets such as these during our weekly UI team meeting or during the Engineering bug scrub on Thursdays.  I don't mind fixing this, but since we're fairly late in the release cycle I unassigned it earlier to allow this ticket to go through the proper vetting process.

/cc [~jloza]

[~kgill], so I don't continue to submit improper tickets, could you please tell me more about "tickets such as these" that are assigned during the Thursday Engineering bug scrub?

What kinds of bugs are assigned this way, please?
If this turns out to be a bug across all wizard summaries, please change title and bump priority

[~lnajjar], looked at what you've pushed, looks good so far. Be sure every field you add breakword to allows spaces as a character, or things will break. 

Thanks! Not sure what other info you needed from me, email or ping me on Lync or IRC and let me know.

Great! I¹m glad you approve what I¹ve done.

There is one more fix I¹d like to make. On ³Create Stack,² ³Parameters²
tab, the ³KeyName² entry field values should break in ³Summary" (see
attached ³Create stacks - KeyName.png²).

I could not find ³KeyName² or anything like it in stack_wizard.pt (see
attached "stack_wizard.pt Summary.png²).

I asked Kamal and David for assistance. As it turns out, both are out on
vacation. But David can¹t not check his email and replied with:

³Line 220 is what generates those parameter labels. The parameters all
come from the template you chose. Try choosing a different template and
you will see a different set of parameters.²

I¹m not sure what he means by ³template² but I can add ³breakword² to ³div
class=Œcolumns value¹² on line 221. That will help with the ³KeyName²
entry field values but it will also affect the ³SSHLocation,²
³InstanceType,² and ³ImageID² entry fields. Those three entry fields do
not include spaces and should not use ³break word.²

With the fix (see attached ³Create stacks - KeyName with break word²),
³KeyName² wraps nicely. But ³breakword² is also applied (but currently has
no effect on the shortened) ³SSHLocation,² ³InstanceType,² and ³ImageID²
entry field values in ³Summary." If those fields ever get long, they will
be affected by ³breakword² even though we don¹t want them to be affected
by ³breakword.²

So, to get ³KeyName² to wrap is it worth risking wrap on the currently
shortened and unaffected ³SSHLocation,² ³InstanceType,² and ³ImageID²
fields?


Lawrence




On 8/14/15, 9:46 AM, "Jenny Loza (JIRA)" <jira@eucalyptus.atlassian.net>
[~lnajjar], don't change anything w.r.t parameters in the summary on create stack. Don't make any changes to that wizard beyond what [~kgill] already did, please.
file changes look good. Passing on for code review.

Tested on Shared Setup #1

Verified name in summary field wraps appropriately.

Good work, [~ashamblin].

Based on [~jloza]'s comments above, she does not want us to fix Summary word wrap in Create Stack.

I found one more place that is not working quite right. When the user is in Create Scaling Group and selects a launch configuration with a long name with a space in the middle, the launch configuration name does not wrap in the Create Scaling Group Summary (see attachment "Create scaling group - Launch configuration" where there is a space after Najjar33).

 !Create scaling group - Launch configuration.png|thumbnail! 

As the developer it looks like I could not get it to work. With your huge developer brain, could you please give it a shot?
